ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
I just learn about mental health when I have to, and would not bother reading additional material on it.
People with severe mental illness can never recover enough to have a good quality of life.
Working in the mental health field is just as respectable as other fields of health and social care.
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Agree; 3 = Somewhat agree; 4 = Somewhat disagree; 5 = Disagree; 6 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: If I had a mental illness, I would never admit this to any of my friends because I would fear being treated differently.
People with mental illness are dangerous more often than not.
Health/social care staff know more about the lives of people treated for a mental illness than do family members and friends.
If I had a mental illness, I would never admit this to my colleagues for fear of being treated differently.
Being a health/social care professional in the area of mental health is not like being a real health/social care professional.
If a senior colleague instructed me to treat people with mental illness in a disrespectful manner, I would not follow their instructions.
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Agree; 3 = Somewhat agree; 4 = Somewhat disagree; 5 = Disagree; 6 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: I feel as comfortable talking to a person with mental illness as I do talking to a person with physical illness
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Agree; 3 = Somewhat agree; 4 = Somewhat disagree; 5 = Disagree; 6 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: It is important that any health/social care professional supporting a person with mental illness also ensures that their physical health is assessed.
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Agree; 3 = Somewhat agree; 4 = Somewhat disagree; 5 = Disagree; 6 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: The public does not need to be protected from people with mental illness.
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Agree; 3 = Somewhat agree; 4 = Somewhat disagree; 5 = Disagree; 6 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: If a person with a mental illness complained of physical symptoms (such as chest pain), I would attribute it to their mental illness.
General practitioners should not be expected to complete a thorough assessment for people with psychiatric symptoms because they can be referred to a psychiatrist.
I would use the terms crazy, nutter, mad, etc., to describe to colleagues people with mental illness that I have seen in my work.
If a colleague told me they had a mental illness, I would still want to work with them
Notes: 1=Strongly agree; 2=Agree; 3 = Somewhat agree; 4 = Somewhat disagree; 5 = Disagree; 6 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: MICA Overall Score
Views of Mental Illness and Psychiatry Domain Score
Knowledge of Mental Illness Domain Score
Disclosure Domain Score
Distinguishing Mental and Physical Health Care Domain Score
Patient Care for people with Mental Illness Domain Score
